content: the bottom then pull the cast on end down until the bottom of your cap is in your stem see photos pg 2 next use your stem s cast off end to stitch the 2 pieces together in order to keep my cap in place as i sew i put my pointer finger into the center hole of my cap and my thumb on the stem like pincers i like to stitch just under the stem s cast off round using backstitch when secure hide ends stuffing stuff your stem with a small amount of stuffing thanks/pattern support thanks for knitting one of my designs i hope you had fun for pattern support just pm me on ravelry 3 fly agaric instructions using your cap color cast on 8 sts leaving a long tail for closing the hole in finishing divide the sts over 2 dpns and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 kfb repeat until end of round 16 sts redistribute the stitches on to 3 dpns needle 1 now has 4 sts and needle 2 & 3 now has 6 sts each you may want to add a stitch marker to show where round begins round 3 k1 kfb repeat until end of round 24 sts round 4 k2 kfb repeat until end of round 32 sts round 5 k3 kfb repeat until end of round 40 sts stitch count check in needle 1 should have 10 sts needle 2 & 3 should have 15 sts each round 6-12 k4 p1 repeat until end of round change to gill color redistribute the stitches so that needle 1 & 3 now has 12 sts each and needle 2 has 16 sts round 13 knit round 14 k1 p3 repeat until end of round round 15 ssk p2 repeat until end of round 30 sts round 16 k1 p2 repeat until end of round round 17 ssk p1 repeat until end of round 20 sts round 18 k1 p1 repeat until end of round round 19 ssk repeat until end of round 10 sts change to stem color if needed remove a needle redistribute the stitches so that needle 1 & 2 now have 5 sts each round 20-29 knit change to grass or earth color round 30 knit round 31 purl round 32 k1 kfb k1 kfb k1 repeat 14 sts round 33 purl round 34 knit cast off tidy up hole while weaving in end hide end in stem hole remains open finishing weave in ends make sure all ends are weaved in or hidden inside your mushroom if desired use your cast on end to stitch the small hole closed at the top or leave it open and insert some chimney smoke embroidery the spots are made with french knots i recommend worsted as sock yarn is so thin that it often pulls back into the fabric and gets lost so you don t run out of yarn half way
